item.title: Disney World Replacing Muppets With Monsters, Inc.
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/disney-world-muppet-courtyard-3d-replaced-monsters-inc-1851706405

Big changes are happening at Disney World in Florida. The company has announced that it plans to shutdown a popular Muppets attraction to make room for a new Monsters, Inc.-themed area and ride. And there was bad news for Aerosmith fans, too.

Suggested Reading

Disney's New Post-Apocalyptic Anime Proves The Mouse Has Good Taste

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

On November 22, Disney confirmed the online rumors and announced its plans to officially shut down Muppet Courtyard and the Muppet*Vision 3D attraction, both of which are located in the same general area of Hollywood Studios in Disney World Orlando. Muppet*Vision3D has been around since 1991.

“That’s right, humans will be able to enter the world of Monsters, Inc. when it is added to the south side of Disney’s Hollywood Studios,” announced Disney.

The new Monsters, Inc. area—inspired by the Pixar animated franchise that started in 2001—will contain a new roller coaster that is set to recreate the famous closet door vault scene from the original movie. The Monsters, Inc. area will also include new dining and shopping options as well as a “whole new theater show.”

In the blog post announcing the news, Disney confirmed that it was having “creative conversations” about how to “preserve the [Muppet*Vision 3D] film” and other parts of the show so fans can “enjoy” it all in the future.

“To make way for the monsters, Kermit the Frog, Miss Piggy and more of their friends will be moving right along to Sunset Boulevard,” said Disney.

What that actually means is that the Rock ‘n’ Roller Coaster, which opened in 1999 in Hollywood Studios, will be re-themed as a Muppets ride featuring various characters from the franchise. Goodbye, Aerosmith, the band the ride has been attached to since it opened. Apparently, Disney also plans to have “music’s biggest stars” team up with the Muppets, but didn’t share any details on what that will entail.

As with any change to a Disney Park, there was a mix of excitement from some online as well as a lot of complaints. Many older fans aren’t happy that Disney is removing more of the park’s history and replacing it with more movie tie-in rides and areas. In August 2024, Disney announced plans to remove the Rivers of America and replace it with a new Cars-inspired area and ride.

The Muppet*Vision 3D attraction and show isn’t closing right away and Disney says people will have time to enjoy it one last time. Disney has yet to provide any specific dates for when it will close and when to expect the new Monsters, Inc. area to open.

.

item.title: A Bunch Of Awesome Games Have Big Free Updates
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/sea-stars-tmnt-remnant-2-roguelike-boss-rush-free-dlc-1851706358

We live in a time of plenty. Perhaps even excess. Before I finish a game, or sometimes even start it, the developers are already releasing free updates ranging from new quality-of-life settings to full-blown content add-ons. Each one makes the game worth revisiting and adds to the pull of picking it up for the first time. Here are six great games that recently added free stuff.

Suggested Reading

The Top 10 Most Played Games On Steam Deck: February 2024 Edition

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

Sea of Stars

Released last year as a retro-style, turn-based RPG inspired by the greats like Chrono Trigger and Super Mario RPG, Sabotage Studio’s Sea of Stars got a major upgrade in September. A free update called Dawn of Equinox marked the game’s one-year anniversary with a new local co-op system, revamped combat, an overhauled prologue, improvements to the secret-seeking parrot relic, and other gameplay tweaks. A paid Throes of the Watchmaker expansion is coming in 2025 that adds a new area and dungeon to explore.

Blasphemous 2

The Game Kitchen’s sequel to its first 2D side-scrolling Souls-like did not disappoint. Blasphemous 2 was one of 2023's great games, introducing new weapon-based playstyles and putting an emphasis on exploration that pushed it much more in the direction of being a proper Metroidvanaia. The free True Torment update arrived alongside the paid Mea Culpa DLC in October. It added new game+ mode with difficulty modifiers, more enemies, abilities, a Labyrinth of Tides challenge, and expanded zones with better connecting areas to streamline backtracking. The way the new game+ mode was structured has been controversial with fans, but changes based on that feedback are due out before the end of November.

Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shredder’s Revenge

2022's TMNT: Shredder’s Revenge is one of the defining beat-em-ups of the dcade, combining retro sensibilities with incredible pixel art animations and game feel. Kicking Foot Clan ass never felt so good, or so responsive. And somehow the game is still getting new free content. September’s paid Radical Reptile DLC added Mondo Gecko and Mona Lisa—deep cuts from the ‘80s cartoon—as new fighters, but a free update alongside the expansion also added a Remix Mode that lets you battle with music from guest artists including Jake Kaufman (Shovel Knight), Tomoya Tomita (Yoshi’s Woolly World), Sean Bialo (Penny’s Big Breakaway), Button Masher (Secret Levels), Keiji Yamagishi (Ninja Gaiden), and Anamanaguchi (Scott Pilgrim vs. The World). It’s perfect for someone like me who’s still grinding out the platinum trophy on PS5.

Front Mission 1st Remake

Front Mission 1st Remake isn’t one of my favorite remakes of a Square Enix RPG in recent years, but it gets the job done and is the only way to play one of the best old-school mech strategy RPGs around. In fact, it got a big boost in October from the free Mercenaries update which added new maps, scenarios, and characters along with a separate mode in which you act as your own merc commander maintaining a squad of Wanzers to complete new missions. The other big part of the update is a local multiplayer mode that includes co-op and PvP skirmishes. I’d love a fully online version, but it’s still a neat novelty for hardcore Front Mission-heads.

Remnant 2

Souls-like loot shooter Remnant II’s final DLC arrived this autumn as well. While the paid The Dark Horizon expansion added new storylines and dungeons, the free update, out at the same time, introduced a boss rush mode for a more concentrated action experience. Cutting out all of the exploration, the new mode just throws enemies big and small at players and their co-op squads with the runs augmented by various buffs earned as they progress. It’s basically another roguelite mode with additional loot that rewards players for taking the punishment.

I Am Your Beast

Most recently, the excellent lo-fi shooter I Am Your Beast, which is kind of like Hotline Miami in 3D, just received a bunch of new levels via its free Support Group update on Friday. The new content offers players even more “extraordinary abilities” to overcome “extreme situations” across nine new levels. That’s a big addition given the base game only had 27. The short but punchy experience just got a little less short and a little more punchy.

.

item.title: PlayStation's Big Black Friday Sale Includes Deals On PS5 Consoles, Games, And PS Plus
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/playstation-psn-ps5-black-friday-deals-ps-plus-games-1851706224

It’s late in November, so its time for another big Black Friday sale. Sure, Black Friday used to be a day, but now it’s spread out over two weeks. And PlayStation is the latest big company to offer a bunch of discounts as we get closer to Thanksgiving.

Suggested Reading

The Best Reveals From The Game Awards 2023

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

On November 22, Sony flipped the big switch (at least I assume it’s controlled by a big switch) and activated a ton of deals on digital games, consoles, controllers, PSVR2 headsets, and more across PSN and PlayStation Direct. Like with Xbox’s Black Friday blowout sale, there are far too many deals to list out everything on sale. Instead, here are some of the best PlayStation Black Friday we found digging through the massive sale.

Most of the following deals expire on December 2, so don’t wait too long to snag what you want.

First up, Sony has temporarily discounted the price of the PS5 Slim by $75. The version that comes with a disc drive is marked down to $425 and the digital-only model is $375.

If you’re looking for a PSVR2 headset, Sony has dropped the price on it by a whopping $250. You can pick up either the PSVR2 or the bundle that includes Horizon: Call of the Mountain for $350. Just be warned that using this headset on your PC, while doable, is a bit of mess for various reasons.

Meanwhile, Sony is also offering discounts on PS Plus Premium and Extra 12-month subscriptions. I was able to upgrade my existing base tier subscription, which runs out in about 9 months, to a Premium plan for just $36.

And here are some of the best and biggest digital game sales we spotted in PlayStation’s Black Friday event:

  • Silent Hill 2 - $56 ($70)
  • EA Sports College Football 25 - $42 ($70)
  • Spider-Man 2 - $40 ($70)
  • Star Wars Jedi: Survivor (PS4) - $25 ($50)
  • Star Wars Outlaws - $53 ($70)
  • Crew Motorfest (PS4/PS5 bundle) - $21 ($70)
  • Fallout 4 GOTY Edition - $16 ($40)
  • Mortal Kombat 1 - $20 ($50)
  • Rise of the Ronin - $40 ($70)
  • Madden 25 - $35 ($70)
  • Batman: Arkham Knight - $4 ($20)
  • Palworld - $23 ($30)
  • Murdered: Soul Suspect - $2 ($20)
  • Space Marine 2 - $56 ($70)
  • Risk of Rain - $2.50 ($10)
  • Risk of Rain 2 - $6.25 ($25)
  • Dead Island Riptide (PS4) - $2 ($20)
  • Prey - $3 ($30)
  • Bulletstorm: Full Clip Edition - $4 ($40)
  • Battlefield 4: Premium Edition - $4 ($40)
  • Battlefield V: Premium Edition - $4 ($40)
  • Suicide Squad - $14 ($70)
  • Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora - $32 ($70)
